msItem.quote: Liber Galfr’ quondam Vicarii de Auebyri quem dedit deo et Ecclesie Sancte Mar’ de Cyrencestr’ Anno dominice Incarnationis mº ccº xxxº viiiº In principio huius libri est quaternus vnus de glosis epistularum pauli Item glose super cantica canticorum Item speculum ecclesie quod abbas Sancti Victoris ex dictis sanctorum patrum compilauit
msItem.note: A cursive hand adds, with a mark for inserting the sentence after cantica canticorum above:
msItem.quote: a sermo augustini de disciplina in domo discipline et de dilectione dei et proximi

Commentario in Cantica Canticorum
Speculum ecclesie
Augustinus de disciplina domini a sixteenth-century hand adds deest

additions.p: Pressmarks: 2048 = 29 (67), 1 Arch 2 1-14 (fol. 1r); MS Jesus Coll. Ox. D. 48 (blue label on spine).

binding.p: Twentieth century binding imitating medieval style (similar to Jesus College 34), whittawed leather over thin wooden boards, new paper endleaves.

history.provenance: Given to Cirencester Abbey by Geoffrey, vicar of Avebury, in 1238.
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24.

msItem.title: Commentary on Paul
msItem.incipit: fol. 2ra Sicut ad antiquum populum erudiendum⸵ post fundamentum legis in qua mandata dei plenarie continebantur propheticus paries fuit necessarius⸵
msItem.explicit: fol. 18vb ut dicit ysaias. Dei dispensationem. id est doctrinam.

listBibl.bibl: Friedrich Stegmüller, Repertorium biblicum medii aevi (Madrid: Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Científicas, 1950–1980), no. 10179.

layoutDesc.layout: Two columns ruled in plummet, pricked on outer edges for frame and individual lies, which are spaced 4.75 mm apart.

additions.p: At top of fol. 2r, Glossa in Epistolas Paulinas written in an eighteenth-century hand.

msItem.author: Robert of Tumbalena
msItem.title: Commentary on the Song of Songs
msItem.incipit: fol. 19r sponsa cristi in sponsi sui deliciis exultat.
msItem.explicit: fol. 57v Cui immensas gracias quousque uiuimus reddamus. cui pro nobis tradito in mortem. et resurgenti in immortalitatem nos ipsos. et spiritum et corpus debemus. Qvi vivit cvm deo patre. in unitate sancti spiritus per infinita secula seculorum amen.

listBibl.bibl: Rossana Guglielmetti, La tradizione manoscritta dei commenti latini al Cantico dei cantici (origini–XII secolo): repertorio dei codici contenenti testi inediti o editi solo nella «Patrologia latina», Millennio Medievale 63, Strumenti e studi, n.s., 14 (Florence: SISMEL, 2006), no. 648.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De disciplina christiana
msItem.incipit: fol. 58r Locutus est ad nos sermo dei. et promtus est ad exhortationem nostram⸵ dicente scriptura.
msItem.explicit: fol. 65v Recole euangelium quod audisti. Ego et pater⸵ unum sumus. Conuersi ad dominum. Amen.

layoutDesc.layout: Gathering 3 (fols. 18r–25v) ruled in drypoint, pricked on outer edges of the page for frame and individual lines. Line spacing 4.5 mm.
Gatherings 4–8 (fols. 26r–65v) ruled in drypoint, pricked on outer edges of the page for frame and individual lines. Line spacing 5.5–6 mm.

handDesc.handNote: Hand shifts on fol. 24v and again at 25r to a darker ink and more formal versions of the script. This is matched by the modified layout with increased line spacing on fol. 26r, remaining until fol. 65v.

decoDesc.decoNote: New chapters begin with 3-line Arabesque initials, alternating between red and green, occasionally with penwork in the same colour. Larger initials on fols. 27v (7-line, with decoration in red, filled in yellow), 34r (6-line, with decoration in red and green, filled in yellow), 35v (5-line, with decoration in red). Differing sizes and styles do not appear to imply a hierarchy. On fol. 58r, opening of Augustine text. red L descends from a lion’s mouth, filled in yellow.

msItem.title: Speculum ecclesie
msItem.rubric: fol. 66r Incipit speculum ecclesie quod abbas sancti uictoris ex dictis sanctorum patrum compilauit.

msItem.incipit: De sacramentis ecclesiasticis ut tractarem. eorundemque misticam dulcedinem uobis exponerem uestra rogauit dilectio.
msItem.explicit: quem quia in eo speculari licet. quid mistice representent singula in ecclesia. speculum ecclesie intitulari placuit.

msItem.incipit: Primum igitur capitulum est de ecclesia.
msItem.explicit: Octauum de supernis secretis quę hic sciri licet.

msItem.incipit: Ecclesia igitur in qua populus conuenit ad laudandum deum.
msItem.explicit: fol. 85r Verius enim inuenit amans. quam disputans.

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
msItem.title: Sententiae
msItem.quote: 4.32.2.4.1 Manifestum est ita uoluisse legem. feminam esse sub uiro ut nulla eius uota que abstinentie causa uouerit reddantur ab ea nisi autor fuerit uir permittendo. 4.32.2.4.9 Qui uir uel mulier continenciam deo offerre non potest. sine communi consensu. nec alter alteri debitum negare debet. 4.32.2.5.8 Si uero mulier habitum miutauerit non potest reuocari. secundum illud. Qui uxorem suam uelare permiserit. aliam non accipiat. sed similiter conuertatur. 4.32.3.2.2 Ieronimus. Quicumque uxori debitum reddereit⸵ uacare non potest orationi nec carnes agni edere. 4.32.3.3.1 Hoc capitulum proprie ad ministros ecclesie pertinere uidetur. quibus non licebat officia sacra celebrare atque misteria. tempore coniugalis amplexus. quo etiam spiritus sancti non datur presentia. cf. app. crit. Nihil fedius est quam amare quasi adulteram.

quote.l: Quis quid ubi quibus auxiliis cur quomodo quando.
Quantum uel qualiter quo uel qua quantus et unde.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in plummet. Pricked on outer edges of page for frame and individual lines. Line spacing 4–5.5 mm.

decoDesc.decoNote: All initials and rubrication in the same shade of red. First sections begin with 4-line initials, with first word in small capitals and every other letter in red. The first chapter begins with a 2-line initial; subsequently, new chapters begin with a 3-line initial. First letter of each sentence slightly enlarged and rubricated.

additions.p: A hand similar to that found in the second part of the manuscript makes marginal corrections.
Additions on fol. 85r in two charter hands, s. xii/xiii.
